risk_factors.reasoning: 10 previous arrests and convictions indicate a pattern of involvement in criminal activity
18 years old is considered young for a significant portion of the population, but not so young that it would necessarily mitigate the risk of rearrest
GED certificate indicates some formal education, which may help with employment and stability, reducing the likelihood of rearrest
Only held one job in a year, indicating instability in employment, which can contribute to financial stress and increase the likelihood of rearrest
Past drug use (marijuana and cocaine) indicates potential substance abuse issues that could lead to further involvement in criminal activity
No reported feelings of depression over the past month, which may indicate better mental health and a lower likelihood of rearrest due to mental health issues
Lived in an urban area with both biological parents, suggesting some level of stability at home, but also potentially exposure to higher crime rates
